clinical_study.brief_title: Family Satisfaction in the Intensive Care Unit - a Multicentre Assessment
clinical_study.official_title: Family Satisfaction in the Intensive Care Unit - a Multicentre Assessment

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the present study is to assess satisfaction in a large sample of next of kin in Swiss-German ICUs.
Secondary aims are to test the hypothesis that family satisfaction is related to ICU structure and process and to factors related to patients and next of kin. Further, the hypothesis will be tested that proxy assessment is possible, i.e. next of kin rate satisfaction with care similar to patients.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess satisfaction in Swiss-German ICUs

secondary_outcome.measure: To test the hypothesis that family satisfaction is related to ICU structure and process To test the hypothesis that proxy assessment is possible

study_pop.textblock: Next of kin of patients cared for in one of the 42 ICU's located in german-speaking Switzerland (ICU recognized by Swiss Society of Intensive Care Medicine).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- family members of patients staying for > 48 hours in an ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of consent,
- insufficient knowledge of German language
